item.title: Here’s what banks are looking at to spot economic trouble, as credit quality sparks concerns
item.description: Despite some fresh doubts about credit that banks addressed this week, the U.S. economy seems to be chugging along.

item.title: This government shutdown could be the longest ever — maybe running until Thanksgiving. What might the economic damage be?
item.description: A MarketWatch poll finds that 47% of respondents say their No. 1 shutdown concern is the potential hit to the U.S. economy.
